>From: Robert Leftwich <digital@...>
>Reply-To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: Re: [junit] Servlet testing...
>Date: Wed, 11 Jul 2001 13:15:27 +1000
>
>At 01:06 PM 11/07/2001, qionghua yang wrote:
> >Hi Robert,
> >
> >   What is Cactus? Could you please give us the link to some Cactus web
> >sites?
>
>Cactus (formerly J2EEUnit), now in the Apache Commons project. It is
>described as:
>
>"Cactus is a simple test framework for unit testing server-side java code.
>It uses JUnit and extends it. It's primary goal is to be able to unit test
>server side java methods which use Servlet objects such as
>HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse, HttpSession, ... (see the full
>feature list). This framework is not a functional test framework which
>views your server classes as a black box and only tests the returned
>results from externally calling your application (see HttpUnit for this).
>Both frameworks are complementary."
>
>See http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/cactus/index.html and
>http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/cactus/features.html
>
>Robert
>
